alert.note: Alert for Larimer (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 10 at 11:49AM MDT until June 10 at 2:45PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Cameron Peak burn scar in... Central Larimer County in north central Colorado... * Until 245 PM MDT. * At 1149 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Cameron Peak Burn Scar. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by thunderstorms in and around the Cameron Peak Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the Cameron Peak Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Red Feather Lakes and areas to the south. This includes the following additional locations... Pingree Hill, Goodell Corner and Bellaire Lake. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Heavy Rainfall will cause flash flooding of small creeks, streams, and ditches in the affected part of the Cameron Peak burn area. Rock slides or debris flows can also be expected across rural roads.
